keyword: how many calories in chicken and salad
title: How Many Calories in Chicken and Salad?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in chicken and salad for a standard serving, including protein, carbs, fat, and tips for variations without dressing.
h1: How Many Calories in Chicken and Salad?
assumptions: One serving: 100 g grilled skinless chicken breast + 200 g mixed greens salad (lettuce, tomatoes, cucumber); no dressing, oil, or added seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by chicken cut, salad ingredients, portion sizes, and preparation method. Check labels or use a tracker for precision.

quick_answer.text: One serving of grilled chicken and salad provides ~195 kcal and ~32 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tbsp olive oil vinaigrette dressing
Use fried chicken breast instead of grilled
Add 50 g feta cheese to the salad

faqs.q: How many calories in chicken and salad without dressing?
faqs.a: About 195 kcal for one serving of 100 g grilled chicken and 200 g mixed greens.

faqs.q: What's the protein in chicken and salad?
faqs.a: Roughly 32 g protein, mostly from the chicken breast.

faqs.q: Does salad add many calories to chicken?
faqs.a: No, 200 g mixed greens add only ~30 kcal, mainly from veggies like tomatoes.

faqs.q: How to lower calories in chicken and salad?
faqs.a: Use baked chicken, skip dressings, and opt for low-cal veggies like lettuce and cucumber.

faqs.q: Are carbs high in chicken and salad?
faqs.a: Low at ~8 g total, with 3 g fiber from the salad vegetables.
